newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: EDP to compete for Portugal mobile phone licence.
newsitem.headline: EDP to compete for Portugal mobile phone licence.

text.p: Portuguese state utility EDP-Electricidade de Portugal plans to compete for a third mobile phone licence in Portugal, its president Antonio de Almeida said.

"We will compete for the third licence, with a national and an international partner, but I cannot give names," Almeida said at the start of a national roadshow to promote the partial privatisation of EDP next month.
"The national partner is not from the telecommunications sector, but the international partner is," he added.
The two present mobile phone licence holders are Telecel-Comunicacoes Pessoais and TMN, a unit of Portugal Telecom.
Telecel shares dropped seven percent on the Lisbon bourse after Almeida said that EDP had suspended talks on the possibility of taking a 20 percent stake in the mobile phone operator.
Telecel shares stood at 13,300 escudos, down 690, in volume of 80,840 shares at 1115 GMT.
